sentences.text: Marilou took off her pink sandals and ran on the sweltering sand.
sentences.gold_explanation: INCREASE - The opening starts with an increase an action and emotive description and so is a small increase in the tension.

sentences.text: She tiptoed into the water, giggling as a wave washed her legs.
sentences.gold_explanation: INCREASE - The action is carrying on the description but there is higher emotional content in her giggling.

sentences.text: She looked back at the big red and white umbrella and waved at her mother, who was getting a much needed suntan.
sentences.gold_explanation: SAME - Carrying on the same level of drama it is a continuation.

sentences.text: Her mother smiled and waved with two fingers, holding a peach in one hand and a bottle of ice cold lemonade in the other.
sentences.gold_explanation: SAME - Continuing at the same level of drama but add detail as to what the mother is doing. The characters perceptions of events remain the same.

sentences.text: A big wave came and swept Marilou's feet, making her fall into the water.
sentences.gold_explanation: BIG INCREASE - As something unexpected has happened increasing the uncertainty of what will happen to the girl. She could be in danger.

sentences.text: She tried to scream but swallowed a gulp of salty water instead.
sentences.gold_explanation: BIG INCREASE - Wanting to scream suggests the girl may be in trouble.

sentences.text: She didn't know which way was up and which was down.
sentences.gold_explanation: INCREASE - There is a smaller increase because the text makes it clear she is confused.

sentences.text: Her sweeping hand touched something with a tiny claw in the sand. She screamed bubbles and tried hard to swim.
sentences.gold_explanation: INCREASE - The further screams effort makes means she is finding it more difficult and more in peril.

sentences.text: The wave receded, dumping the startled girl upon the soft, wet beach.
sentences.gold_explanation: DECREASE - There is a small decrease as the girl is no longer struggling but it's not clear what has happened. Is she okay?

sentences.text: Marilou coughed and rubbed her eyes, struggling to get back up.
sentences.gold_explanation: DECREASE - She is not completely fine but able to get up and so the tension is slowly decreasing.

sentences.text: Grains of sand in her blue swimsuit scratched her skin.
sentences.gold_explanation: SAME - This is a description of what has just happened and so doesn't affect the future tension.

sentences.text: She looked back toward her mother, who was standing up with a worried frown partly covered by sunglasses.
sentences.gold_explanation: INCREASE - Small increase in tension because here mother is worried.

sentences.text: Marilou ran back to the big umbrella, tiptoeing through the hot sand.
sentences.gold_explanation: DECREASE - It seems as if she is okay.

sentences.text: She smelled of salt and seaweeds.
sentences.gold_explanation: SAME - Descriptive but doesn't change the level of tension.

sentences.text: She took her mother's big, warm hand with her cold, wet one.
sentences.gold_explanation: DECREASE - Reuniting with her mother reduce the tension.

sentences.text: Come play with me in the waves, Mommy! This is the bestest vacation ever!
sentences.gold_explanation: BIG DECREASE - She is very happy and the wave didn't cause any harm.
